metadata.description: The resource group containing the storage account of the image vhd file.
URI of the sysprepped image vhd file to be used to create the session host VMs. For example, https://rdsstorage.blob.core.windows.net/vhds/sessionhostimage.vhd

This prefix will be used in combination with the VM number to create the VM name. If using “rdsh” as the prefix, VMs would be named “rdsh-0”, “rdsh-1”, etc. You should use a unique prefix to reduce name collisions in Active Directory.
Number of session hosts that will be created and added to the hostpool.
The size of the session host VMs.
A username in the domain that has privileges to join the session hosts to the domain. For example, “user1@contoso.com”.
The password that corresponds to the existing domain username.
The resource group containing the existing virtual network.
The name of the virtual network the VMs will be connected to.
The subnet the VMs will be placed in.
The RD Broker URL of the RDmi deployment the session hosts will be connected to.
The name of the RDS Tenant in the RDmi deployment.
The name of the hostpool to be created in the RDS Tenant.
The UPN that has rights in the RDS Tenant to create the hostpool. For example, “admin1@contoso.com”
The password that corresponds to the tenant admin UPN.
The base URL for RDmi info
